ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and say things which they do not do,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And they say what they do not do,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and say things which they do not act upon,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and preaching what they themselves never practice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And they speak what they do not do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And that they say what they do not do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And that they say that which they do not do,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and how they say that which they do not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And how they say that which they do not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: preaching what they do not practice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And that they say that which they do not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and that they say what they do not do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And that they say what they practise not?-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And that they say what they do not do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and they say what they do not do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And how they say what they do not do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And that they say what they do not do? -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:226] and that they say, we do, what they do not do?, in other words, that they lie.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And how they say) in their poetry (that which they do not?) they keep mentioning "I" and "I" when things are not as they say; it is also said that this means: they say things which they cannot do; and hence both poet and narrator are in error.
